snippet: President Obama said the United States was taking the first step toward filing a legal case against the Chinese government over its reported hoarding of rare earth metals.
abstract: Pres Obama announces that the United States is taking the first step toward filing a legal case against the Chinese government over its reported hoarding of rare earth metals, in what has been a long-running trade dispute; United States is being joined by the European Union and Japan, but many trade analysts and industry experts say announcement and its timing may reflect a political strategy.
lead_paragraph: President Obama said the United States was taking the first step toward filing a legal case against the Chinese government over its reported hoarding of rare earth metals.

headline.seo: Obama Takes Up Trade Case Against China
headline.main: Obama Files a Complaint Over China
headline.print_headline: Obama Files A Complaint Over China
